column33: and a professor of neurology at the NYU School of Medicine. The New York Times has referred to him as \u201cthe poet laureate of medicine.\u201d\r\n\r\nHe is best known for his collections of neurological case histories
column34: including The Man who Mistook his Wife for a Hat
column35: Musicophilia: Tales of Music and the Brain and An Anthropologist on Mars. Awakenings
column36: his book about a group of patients who had survived the great encephalitis lethargica epidemic of the early twentieth century
column37:
inspired the 1990 Academy Award-nominated feature film starring Robert De Niro and Robin Williams.

Dr. Sacks was a frequent contributor to the New Yorker and the New York Review of Books.

([source][1])


  [1]: https://www.oliversacks.com/about-oliver-sacks/"
